full_title_en: Recognition of Stroke in the Emergency Room (ROSIER) Scale
medium_description_en: Distinguishes between acute stroke and stroke mimics.

seo.meta_description_en: The ROSIER Scale identifies acute stroke patients (versus stroke mimics).
seo.keywords_en: Stroke, cva, tia, tpa, neuro, cerebrovascular accident, transient ischemic attack

how_to_use.use_case_en: Do you use the ROSIER Scale and want to contribute your expertise? Join our contributor team!

next_steps.advice_en: Do you use the ROSIER Scale and want to contribute your expertise? Join our contributor team!

about.more_info_en:
Likelihood of stroke:

ROSIER Score

Interpretation

≤0

Stroke unlikely

>0

Stroke possible

Original/Primary Reference.text: Nor AM, Davis J, Sen B, et al. The Recognition of Stroke in the Emergency Room (ROSIER) scale: development and validation of a stroke recognition instrument. Lancet Neurol. 2005;4(11):727-34.

Other References.text: Yock-Corrales A, Babl FE, Mosley IT, Mackay MT. Can the FAST and ROSIER adult stroke recognition tools be applied to confirmed childhood arterial ischemic stroke?. BMC Pediatr. 2011;11:93.

Validation.text: Jackson A, Deasy C, Geary UM, Plunkett PK, Harbison J. Validation of the use of the ROSIER stroke recognition instrument in an Irish emergency department. Ir J Med Sci. 2008;177(3):189-92.
Jiang HL, Chan CP, Leung YK, Li YM, Graham CA, Rainer TH. Evaluation of the Recognition of Stroke in the Emergency Room (ROSIER) scale in Chinese patients in Hong Kong. PLoS ONE. 2014;9(10):e109762.
Mingfeng H, Zhixin W, Qihong G, Lianda L, Yanbin Y, Jinfang F. Validation of the use of the ROSIER scale in prehospital assessment of stroke. Ann Indian Acad Neurol. 2012;15(3):191-5.

creator_info.about_en: Azlisham Mohd Nor, MD, is a practicing neurologist at Plymouth Hospital in the United Kingdom. He is also the director of the Plymouth Stroke Research Network. Dr. Nor’s research focuses primarily on neurology and stroke treatment.

input_schema.subheading: New, acute onset (or on awakening from sleep) finding of any of the following:
